original_title: A YEAR WHOSE DAYS ARE LONG
overview: A jail setting juxtaposed against the wedding of Princess Diana on television thrusts both post modern irreverence and reification of icons onto the refracted visceral harshness of a spartan locked environment, capturing both the confining artifice of modern life and the all too real loss of liberty experience by women in prison.
title: A YEAR WHOSE DAYS ARE LONG
